channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The new American Dream has parents easing up on college expectations for their kids—1 in 3 are now open to trade school instead
item.description: “Parents are waking up,” career strategist says. “College doesn’t carry the same [return on investment] it once did.”

item.title: Sneaking unemployment rate means the U.S. economy is inching closer to a key recession indicator, says Moody’s
item.description: "The trends are not our friends here," said Moody's economist Cris deRitis.

item.title: Meta’s 28-year-old billionaire prodigy says the next Bill Gates will be a 13-year-old who is ‘vibe coding’ right now
item.description: Teenagers, Alexandr Wang argues, have a built-in edge.

item.title: BBDO International CEO: The biggest risks are the ones not taken
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The CEO behind the world’s top sleep and meditation app says most leaders are operating at ‘about 20%’ without a ‘fully recharged’ battery
item.description: David Ko said most executives will say they’re good when you ask how they are. Some additional interrogation suggests the opposite is true.

item.title: A sell signal has been triggered on stocks. Here's what tends to happen next.
Airfares fell more than 5% in November — but will the deals last?
Oracle’s stock is rising on report of U.S. joint venture for TikTok
Nasdaq closes sharply higher, Dow and S&P 500 snap 4-day losing streaks
Marijuana stocks sell off as Trump signs executive order to reclassify cannabis
